data.title: Richard
meta_keywords: something interesting for the keywords here
data.meta_description: Richard “Rick” Peters McGinn, 67, of Tybee Island, Georgia died Saturday, July 15, 2023. He was born February 13, 1956, in Savannah, to the late Ric
data.text:
Erin and family, I’m sorry for your loss. My thoughts are with you.

- Jodi Daniels, Mt. Pleasant, SC

So sorry to hear about Rick. I have fond memories of my cousin when he was the grounds keeper at Wormsloe Plantation. My heart is with you all.

- Cindy Work, Wilmington, NC

We extend our sincere condolences to the McGinn family. May God grant you all the peace and comfort needed during this time of bereavement. May the beautiful memories and time spent with Rick bring you comfort for the days ahead. We love you Dina, Tony, Van, and Imani

- Dina Jones-Williams , Port Wentworth, GA

May he rest in peace and May he rise in peace.

- Manuel Bettencourt , Fernandina Beach , FL

May he rest in peace and May he rise in peace.

- Manuel Bettencourt , Fernandina Beach , FL

Dear Manuel, Erin, Nancy and David, Anne & I were so shocked & saddened to hear of Rick’s passing. He and I had just spoken recently about his move to Tybee and how much he was enjoying living there. As ya’ll know, we made many memories together after becoming good friends at BC. I will always hold him in a special place in my heart. May God have mercy on his soul and give him eternal rest. You are all in our thoughts and prayers.

- Kevin Shea, Augusta, GA

Rick was a good person. I loved him dearly, and will miss him forever. He will be missed by many. The world is not the same without him. I trust he is in a better place. My deepest condolences to his family. The fond golden memories of Rick on 49th Street and beyond will live on in our hearts.

- John Miller, Savannah, GA

So long my good friend and brother. Just as in the poem by Van Dyke you have crossed over the horizon. I’m sure yours was a pirate ship though. To the McGinn family I offer my condolences and thanks for always treating me as one of your own. Especially on Christmas Eve when Rick and I took turns gifting each other that ridiculous present. So, to Rick smooth sailing Pirate. And, just at the moment when someone says, "There, she is gone," there are other eyes watching her coming, and other voices ready to take up the glad shout, "Here she comes!"

- Donnie Bell, Tybee Island, Georgia

We were so sorry to hear about Rick. May he rest in peace.

- James and Sally Chandler, Tybee Island, GA

I met Rick through my son while they worked together at Ace Hardware in East Dublin. Each time that I would go in, Rick and I would talk BBQ plans for that weekend or any other mundane topic that may come up. He was a pleasure to talk to each time. My son also spoke very highly of Rick while they were coworkers. My condolences to the entire family.

- Brent Mimbs, East Dublin , Georgia

I met Rick through my son while they worked together at Ace Hardware in East Dublin. Each time that I would go in, Rick and I would talk BBQ plans for that weekend or any other mundane topic that may come up. He was a pleasure to talk to each time. My son also spoke very highly of Rick while they were coworkers. My condolences to the entire family.

- Brent Mimbs, East Dublin , Georgia

I had the pleasure of teaching Rick ay Benedictine. He was a thoughtful student. Many years later, he thanked me for my class and encouraging him to continue reading. He also took my whole family on an excellent tour of Wormsloe. May his memory be eternal!

- Fr. John A. Caparisos, Savannah, GA

Nancy, Erin, Manuel, David, We were so sorry to hear of the news of Cousin Rick and our thoughts and prayers are with you at this time. Love, Kathleen and George Doyle and all the McGinn family in Nashville.

- Kathleen McGinn Doyle, Mobile, AL

David, Nancy, Erin & Manuel I was very sadden to hear of the news of Rick's passing, even though we did not stay in touch I have very fond memories of him and the fun we had at Wormslo, he always had jokes. My sincere condolences to the McGinn family, you are in my thoughts & prayers.

- Carolynn Veltrup (McGinn), Middleburg, Florida

A candle has been lit!

- Vincent Powers , Savannah , Georgia

My sincere condolences to the McGinn family. You are in my thought & prayers. Love Michael

- Michael Waldrop, Jacksonville, Florida

Sending prayers for peace and strength during this time.

- CHS4Storys, Mt Pleasant , SC

McGinn family, my thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time. Rick had a great love of music in which he shared with me back in the 80's and 90's. John Prine and Springsteen continue to be 2 of my favorites to this day. God Bless Barry Coppage

- Barry Coppage, Rincon , Ga

Please accept my condolences. Rick was a special person that is dearly missed. He would sacrifice for those around him and brought smiles and love to many of his friends through the ministry of a garden. He was a friend, a co-worker and a political sparring partner. I love you brother, may you rest in peace. Praying for each of you.

- Chris Council , Cadwell, Georgia

A candle has been lit!

Requiescat In Pace

- Thomas Murphy, Savannah, Ga

Rick was a wonderful man. He was always a kind soul. I know he will be dearly missed by all. I have all of the family and friends in my thoughts and prayers. Hugs!!!

- Christa C Beard, Jacksonville, FL

I’m so sorry to hear of Rick’s passing. He was such a sweet guy. Sincerely, Becky Keating

- Becky Keating , Claxton , Ga

A candle has been lit!

God Bless my BC Brother- Rick was a great guy- He will be missed

- Michael Watson, Savannah, GA

I am so sorry for your loss. I am sorry I could not make the trip home to celebrate Rick's life with you. Please know that you and your family are in my thoughts and prayers.

- Paula Helmly Parker, Mobile, AL

R.I.P.

- Piper , Seneca, SC

A candle has been lit!

- Sandra Williams, Seneca, SC

I'm so sad to hear about Rick. I'm grateful that he reached out to me in the last few years and that we got to speak on the phone a few times this last winter. It definitely felt like some healing for both of us. I'm glad that I was a part of your family so many years ago. I hope you all are doing well.

- Linda Erzinger, Louisville, Ky

one classic man in kennebunkport maine

- james A oconnell, cape coral, Florida
